title: OT55: Thready For Hillary
summary:
Key ideas:
- Scott is requesting users to not post controversial comments anonymously, as he IP bans anonymous accounts easily.
- He is considering banning anonymous commenting altogether due to trouble with spam.
- Scott is trying to figure out how to teach Akismet to avoid marking good, frequent posters as spambots.
- He is trying to find ways to steer open thread conversation away from specific topics without banning them altogether.

Key learnings:
- Anonymity can lead to IP bans, and Scott is considering banning anonymous commenting altogether.
- There are issues with Akismet detecting spambots, and it is possible that frequent commenters can get caught up in it as well.

Key questions:
- Can anyone think of ways to direct open thread conversation away from controversial topics without banning them altogether?
- How can one teach Akismet to avoid marking frequent commenters as spambots?
